alert.note: Alert for Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 5:12PM EDT until May 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Vermont and southern Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, far southern Addison. In southern Vermont, Rutland. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rutland, West Rutland, Proctor, Rutland City, Ira, Pittsford, Clarendon, Castleton, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Middletown Springs, Hubbardton, Poultney, Mendon, Tinmouth, Brandon, Chittenden, Wallingford, Shrewsbury, Sudbury and Goshen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Minor, poor drainage flooding of streets, underpasses, and low-lying areas is expected in the City of Rutland. This includes, but is not limited to portions of Clover Street and Water Street. Some basement flooding is also possible. If encountering high water in a vehicle, turn around to avoid becoming stalled.
